stream_context.summary: Work-focused session building Course 14’s snowy craft section: refining styrofoam terrain, designing a spring→button→temporary bridge sequence, implementing crayon-drawing mechanics, coding paper-snowball hazards and ambient paper-snowflakes, and showcasing HUD/collectable system changes.

development_findings.summary: Course 14 now uses a craft-snow aesthetic: styrofoam hills, cardboard platforms, a spring jump, a button that extends a temporary bridge, and a crayon used to ‘draw’ the star at the end.
development_findings.quote: "Dude this is so cute… the styrofoam suddenly fits in so much better… you use the spring, there’s gonna be a button here that spawns a bridge… then you finally arrive where you can draw with the crayon."

development_findings.summary: Bridge will emerge from paired matchboxes; it extends for a few seconds after switch press, then retracts at increasing speed.
development_findings.quote: "Imagine you press the switch, the bridge comes out, and then it slowly goes back… a matchbox on each side… that’s a good decision."

development_findings.summary: Snowballs are being rebuilt as crumpled-paper balls that fall at fixed tempo and home in on Mario, using optimized low-poly mesh and random rotation.
development_findings.quote: "It really does look like crumpled up paper… they alternate left and right a little bit… rendering all of these combined is about as much as two of Mario’s arms."

development_findings.summary: Ambient snowfall repurposes the Course 7 leaf particle system; 96 white paper-snowflake sprites spawn only while Mario is on the styrofoam area to save performance.
development_findings.quote: "This effect is not optimized; we can definitely do this… now it looks like actual snowflakes made in kindergarten."

development_findings.summary: HUD/collectable overhaul: each level has 7 acts; red coins are confined to one area and never kick the player out; 100-coin stars removed; new global ‘Yoshi coin’ tasks with radar guidance on the 7th star.
development_findings.quote: "Red coins in this game are always contained to one area… no level has a 100-coin star… once you have the first six stars you get the seventh star which is just find the egg coins with a radar."

development_findings.summary: Demo plan: a revised Course 1 will release in a few weeks (after BLJ and channel update videos) to showcase improvements; an NPC accepts coins three times to upgrade his hat as a placeholder for future overworld economy.
development_findings.quote: "For the demo there’s just gonna be one guy… you can gift me your coins and I will buy myself a new hat… you get nothing, the guy just gets a cool hat."

development_findings.summary: Technical tooling: Kaze chose Godot for any future original game because of faster iteration, better low-end performance, and easier console porting compared to Unreal Engine 5.
development_findings.quote: "I talked to Godot-dev today… it’s gonna be a lot more viable than Unreal because Unreal is so goddamn slow."

development_findings.summary: Several engine bugs addressed live: lighting discrepancies on new models, wrong object list preventing snowball damage, alpha-data flag auto-enabled in Fast64, and a typo that froze bridge movement.

context_findings.summary: Kaze deliberately set the stream to ‘work first, entertainment coincidental’, reflecting a productivity-over-performance mindset.
context_findings.quote: "My priority today is not on entertaining but rather on getting work done… entertainment will be coincidental."

context_findings.summary: He integrates personal life on stream: mid-stream workouts, cake break, and a cameo by spouse Zeina holding their baby.
context_findings.quote: "This is literally just a stream of me living my life at this point… I've got three babies now: my wife, my daughter and the game."

context_findings.summary: Philosophy on ROM-hacking: removes frustrating design (100-coin stars), adds exploration incentives, aims for ‘fun movement’ and visible craftsmanship.
context_findings.quote: "This is what video games should be like."

context_findings.summary: Recounts ignoring a 2019 Nintendo DMCA with a profane reply; perceives himself as too ‘mentally unstable’ for Nintendo to pursue, illustrating cavalier attitude toward legal threats.
context_findings.quote: "They basically were like we can take your entire life away… and I responded suck my cock."

context_findings.summary: Believes staying physically fit aids mental performance; performs push/pull/legs routine during long dev streams.

biobak.summary: Gave feedback on new styrofoam texture and overall scene vibe; reworked ‘zoo’ graphics earlier; will pre-render textures (e.g., matchstick box) and possibly redesign exclamation box.
biobak.quote: "Biobak, what do you think of the new styrofoam? Your opinion here matters."

zeina.summary: Will create a polished matchbox texture and other UI art; appeared on stream with their baby, illustrating personal-professional overlap.
zeina.quote: "Surely this conveys the idea and Zeina can make a decent one."

key_stories.title: Red & Yoshi Coin Revamp
key_stories.summary: Kaze dislikes how 100-coin stars interrupt exploration. He redesigns collectables: red coins confined to single area, Yoshi coins tied to hidden tasks with radar, seventh star unlocked after six normal stars.
key_stories.challenge: Traditional Mario 64 coin structure felt tedious and confusing.
key_stories.process: Analyzed pain points, removed 100-coin star, added radar-guided Yoshi coins, coded HUD changes.
key_stories.outcome: Levels encourage organic exploration without punishment while still rewarding thorough players.
key_stories.key_quote: "I tried to get a star and then I have like 50 coins… that just feels like shit, so they are completely different now."

key_stories.title: The Matchbox Bridge
key_stories.summary: Course 14 needs a temporary bridge that feels handmade. Kaze experiments with cardboard ideas before settling on twin matchboxes that slide out and retract on a timer.
key_stories.challenge: Create a visually coherent, mechanically readable bridge within craft theme.
key_stories.process: Brainstormed cardboard, popsicle, highway concepts; coded retracting platform; fixed movement bug caused by ‘=’ vs ‘-’ typo.
key_stories.outcome: Functioning bridge with unique matchbox aesthetic; pending texture polish by Zeina.
key_stories.key_quote: "We went from zero good ideas to two good ones… if you have two great ideas, why not use both?"

key_stories.title: Snowball Hazard Overhaul
key_stories.summary: Original cotton ball idea looked wrong. Kaze pivots to crumpled paper snowballs with paper-snowflake ambience.
key_stories.challenge: Make a snow hazard that fits craft theme and N64 limits.
key_stories.process: Modeled low-poly irregular sphere, coded constant-tempo spawner targeting Mario, reused leaf effect for snowflakes, optimized draw calls.
key_stories.outcome: Visually consistent hazard costing minimal performance; needs spawn-source prop but otherwise complete.
key_stories.key_quote: "Rendering all of these combined is about as much as two of Mario’s arms."
